ConversationAction.text: ”Hello, is there something you need?“
“What do you want?”
Aunn looked at the report in her hand: “There's nothing more for now.”
“Feel free to take it!”
”You touched your pocket and found you didn't have that much money. Maybe you can ask someone here to sell you some?“

“It seems like... you don’t really need anything?” The girl scratched her head.
“The shrine maiden asks you to buy some cinnamon. Can I buy 1 piece from you? Just 1 will do. I can offer 1000 Marks.”
“Thank you, the amount has been transferred to your account.”
You touched your pocket and realized you didn't have what the girl needed. “Sorry, I used to have some, but I can't find it now.”

You've chatted enough; it’s better not to disturb her anymore…
“Hello, is there something you need?” The girl puts down her notebook and turns to look at you.

Option.text: “Is this supply station built by the Kappa Heavy Industries? I didn’t expect to find a resting place in the deep sea.”

ConversationAction.text: “Actually, Kappa are not very friendly to humans. They built the supply stations to better exploit the alien ruins here. It was only due to the Alliance’s substantial offer for cooperation that the Kappa agreed to open these stations.”

Option.text: “There’s no sign of the Tengu Task Force here. Don’t they patrol this place?”

ConversationAction.text: “Tengus dislike confined spaces. They’re building larger stations for themselves. Other than the outposts, they rarely patrol places like this.”

Option.text: ”Can I use the supplies at the supply station?“

ConversationAction.text: The girl nodded, “You can use whatever you need; that’s what the supply station is for.”
You remembered you still had some unfinished business and hurried away.
You think for a moment and decide it’s not necessary to ask for more.
“If you need help, you can come to find me later as well?” The girl’s smile is reassuring.
